alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 8:02PM CDT until March 29 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo, Sumter and Hale Counties. .Levels are falling on the Tombigbee River at Demopolis Lock and Dam but a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Monday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 68.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands in the area occurs and cattle should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 71.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Sunday was 72.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 49.3 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 68.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
